metadata.titel_preek: Easter (Easter Day, Second Sunday, Third Sunday)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and the darkness of human doubt to reveal Himself as the living Lord, thereby creating faith where hope was obliterated.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Revelation and Life (The Gift of Eternal Light)
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
grant his divine life to all who come to him

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Living Word
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible sets before us a baffling, even an infuriating God who is really God

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (represented by Mary, Thomas, and Job)
tekstueel_bewijs: opened unto us the gate of everlasting life
to you and to me: 'Blessed are they who do not see and yet believe'
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a revelation they cannot produce.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Proclaimed Word
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith in those who gladly hear
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (via Spirit/Word).

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Sin, Satan, and the 'Night' (Human Impotence)
tekstueel_bewijs: the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the ontological reality of death and the 'kingdom of darkness' which no human can exit.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to cope with grief and doubt through rituals and demands for proof.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Mary / Thomas / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human program fails (Mary finds an empty tomb, Thomas's doubt is overwhelmed), serving as the 'lack' that only the Primary Program (God's action) can fill.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
The Lord looks straight through Thomas... to you and to me.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: we just have to help each other through it
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Being Able' (Pouvoir) in the face of human 'Not Being Able.' Grace is presented as God's sovereign competence breaking into human incompetence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S1 (Doubt/Darkness) to S1 (The Risen Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human effort (~S2) but by God's invasion of S2 to establish S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is described as 'merciless' and 'irrevocable'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are the bewildered recipients of an action they did not expect and could not assist.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'types' of human helplessness and doubt, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God meets them in their failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the pressure to 'produce' faith is removed as faith is a 'gift' created by the Word.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic view of revelation and resurrection.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three sections (Easter, Thomas, Job) are perfectly integrated around the theme of God's sovereign self-revelation.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the competence (faith) that the Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'power of darkness' and the 'death of sin' from which only a 'life-giving Spirit' can raise us.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's 'Pouvoir-faire'. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver (Destinataire).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and enables the response of faith.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It avoids the trap of turning the resurrection into a 'lesson' and keeps it as an 'event' where God is the sole Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'night' imagery, Greimas reveals that 'night' functions as a cosmic Opponent that only a divine Subject can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of the Greek to show how the sermon's 'grammar' mirrors the Gospel's theology of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Doubting Thomas' section isn't a moral exhortation to 'stop doubting,' but a narrative of Christ (Subject) overcoming Doubt (Opponent) to give Faith (Object) to Thomas (Receiver).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids 'Exemplarism' by treating Job and Thomas as recipients of grace rather than heroes of faith.
